title: Calories in One Eggs Benedict
meta_description: Discover calories in a eggs benedict, including full nutrition breakdown, macros, and variations for this classic brunch dish.
assumptions: Standard serving: 1 English muffin (2 halves), 2 poached eggs, 2 slices Canadian bacon, ~1/4 cup hollandaise sauce; no extras like potatoes.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, portion size, ingredients, and preparation method. Restaurant versions may differ; check labels or recipes when available.

quick_answer.text: One serving of Eggs Benedict has about 825 kcal, with high fat from hollandaise and good protein from eggs and bacon.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Vegetarian version with spinach instead of bacon

faqs.q: How many calories in a eggs benedict serving?
faqs.a: Approximately 825 kcal for a standard serving.

faqs.q: What's the protein in Eggs Benedict?
faqs.a: About 25 g protein from eggs and Canadian bacon.

faqs.q: Why is Eggs Benedict high in fat?
faqs.a: Hollandaise sauce contributes most of the 60 g total fat, including 25 g saturated.

faqs.q: Can I make Eggs Benedict lower calorie?
faqs.a: Yes, skip the hollandaise or use a lighter version to reduce by ~250 kcal.

faqs.q: How much sodium in one Eggs Benedict?
faqs.a: Around 1500 mg, mainly from bacon and sauce; watch if on a low-sodium diet.
